modules.description: The module handles configuring feature types (continuous or discrete), setting value bounds, and constructing decision trees, while managing training data and classifications. It operates on training sets, data vectors, and decision trees, enabling tasks like feature value association, range validation, and tree-based classification. Use cases include preparing structured data for machine learning models and ensuring discrete features adhere to specified integer ranges during tree generation.

Generates and manages random forests for classification tasks using C4.5-compatible data structures. It supports parallel tree construction, classification of new data points, and detailed vote distribution analysis. Models can be persisted to and loaded from files for reuse.

Generates and manages random forests for classification tasks using C4.5-compatible data structures. Performs parallel tree construction, classifies data points with confidence scores, and supports model persistence through file serialization. Accepts training sets, data vectors, and pre-trained forests to enable scalable machine learning workflows.

Generates a random forest from a training set with parallel processing support, classifies data points using a trained model, and provides raw vote percentages for probabilistic interpretation. Operates on structured data types including training sets, data vectors, and category labels. Saves and restores models to and from files for persistent storage and reuse.

Generates decision trees and ensembles of trees from structured data, using entropy-based splitting and pruning. Processes labeled datasets with categorical and numerical features, supporting both classification and regression tasks. Trains models to predict outcomes based on input feature vectors, suitable for applications like customer segmentation and risk assessment.

Generates and applies random forests for classification, leveraging parallel processing to handle structured data like training sets, vectors, and labels. Supports model persistence through file-based saving and loading. Returns vote percentages for probabilistic insights during classification. Can process large datasets efficiently and reuse trained models across sessions.
